intro: Nonatelia oligantha, commonly known as the slender-stemmed mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Loranthaceae and typically grows on the branches of trees such as oaks and pines. The plant has small, oval-shaped leaves and produces white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Its berries are usually red or orange and contain seeds that are dispersed by birds. Nonatelia oligantha plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food for various bird species.
